Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of horse. Head broken from a figure of a horse, modelled in the round, with a well-indicated mane terminating in a topknot. The neck was thrown on a wheel and the head, ears and mane added and hand modelled, with much incision: how the rest of the animal was made cannot be deduced. Covered with a white dressing, then faint black paint added for eyes and main details. Red Nile silt with fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Fabric appears identical to those produced in Naukratis. Fischer cites this as a parallel for a Hellenistic period horses head now at Dresden (1994, 413-4, no. 1102). Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3748)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.269) (Phase 1)
Condition: Good preservation of coating. The ears and the topknot are broken and the mane damaged.
